column43: "dc.description": "The patient sample specific dynamic path map is built on the basis of the probabilistic path model and the measured patient data based on the attributes for the path element
column44: with some attributes for the path element being a priori known
column46: in which the path element is cross-correlated and assigns an inflow level to one or more paths. The preferred dynamic path map provides the content of patient data measured for the selected reference path activity."

column166: and / or other stimuli from the user ' s environment and operates autonomously to fulfill the winds of the inferred or anticipated user. In one aspect
column167: the detailed description relates to telephone-based perception of the scene shown by the camera of the telephone. The image processing tasks applied to the scene may be selected from among a variety of alternatives by reference to resource costs
column172: and the like. The phone may apply some more or less resources to the image processing task
column173: depending on how the task progresses successfully
column174: or based on the user ' s clear interest in the task. In some devices
column175: data may be referenced to the cloud for analysis or for collection. Recognition and identification of the appropriate device response (s) can be assisted by secondary information
column176: such as context. A number of other features and devices are also described in detail."
column335: "dc.description": "The intelligent automation assistant system invokes external services at the appropriate time to obtain information and perform various tasks
column336: in association with the user in an integrated
column337: interactive manner using natural language dialogs. The system may be implemented using any of a number of different platforms
column341: or any combination thereof. In one embodiment
column342: the system is based on interrelated domains and sets of tasks and utilizes additional functionality that is operated by external services with which the system can interact."

column386: "dc.description": "Systems and methods are provided for grasping the intent of the wearer of the device mainly based on the movements of the eyes. Such a system can be included in an unobtrusive headwear that performs eye tracking as well as controls the screen display. The system may also utilize the remote eye tracking camera (s)
column387: remote displays and / or other auxiliary inputs. The screen layout is optimized to facilitate the formation of fast eye signals and reliable detection. Detection of eye signals is based on tracking physiological movements of the eye under spontaneous control by the wearer of the device. The detection of eye signals results in actions that are compatible with wearable computing and a wide variety of display devices."

column417: "dc.description": "When the sensing device moves in relation to a predetermined surface area
column418: a sensing device is disclosed that senses area identity data and generates motion data
column419: wherein the area identity data indicates the identity of the area
column420: and the motion data is the area. Indicative of movement of the sensing device in relation to said surface
column421: said surface having code data indicative of at least one region associated with said surface disposed thereon
column422: said sensing device using said at least some code data. Area identity detection means configured to sense data
column423: motion detection means configured to generate the motion data
column424: and communication means configured to communicate the area identity data and the motion data to a predetermined computer system."
